Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black; at right edge part of rosette (alternating added white and added red petals); exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of shoulder, neck and head (all with red spots) of boar, to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as coming from a light-walled and big chalice belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice kraters. Chalices in this group also display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 44)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 90, p. 263, no. 544, pl. 67) (incorrectly labelled 1924.12-1.1287)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0523) (phase 2)
